Manx: My Chiarn Mayor mranne Vanninnee as deiney Manninee, Liverpool.
English: My Lord Mayor. Manx women and Manxmen, of Liverpool

Manx: T’eh jannoo taitnys vooar dou dy akin yn sheshaght mooar shoh ayns shoh noght.
English: It affords me great pleasure to see this large assembly here tonight.

Manx: Ta mee credjal dy vel quaaltysyn gollrish shoh cooney dy chiangle shin ny s’chenney cooidjagh ayns thalloo joarree; as ta unnaneys niart. Ec y traa myr shoh nyn smooinaghtyn chyndaa ny smoo gys yn Ellan ain: Mannin veg veen ayns mean y cheayn,” as gys traaghyn ta er-sooyl; ny myr ta’n arrane gra:—
English: I think that meetings like this help to bind us closer togther in a strange land; and union is strength. At a time like this our thoughts turn more to our Island: Dear little Mann in the midst of the sea, and to the times that are past; or as the song says :--

Manx: Eisht ta cooinaghtyn meiygh as millish

English: Of the hearts in Ellan Vannin,

Manx: Ta mee treishteil dy bee dy chooilley unnane jiu bio son ymmodee dy bleeantyn dy eamaghey lesh cree as coraa :
English: I trust that you will all live for many years to cry with heart and voice:

Manx: Ellan Vannin veg villish veen dy bragh
English: Dear sweet little Isle of Mann for ever.
